column4: Hello everyone, I need help with an issue regarding nautilus. I did 2 file transfers to a network drive ( of about 2GB each) yesterday. Today I notice that the file transfer window is locked, blank, and nautilus is using lots of CPU recources. I've rebooted and still no changes n cpu consumption. Any ideas? Running ubuntu 8.10
what do you mean by "lots of CPU resources"?
sry, meant to write its using 100% of cpu
you've verified this in top? could you pastebin some top output?
sure, one sec
http://pastebin.com/d46c44dc
could you show the top lines as well? also, did the file transfer you mentioned complete?
http://pastebin.com/d27f81cc0
i assume "garbage" is a known user :-)
yes
its been like this ever since I did that big file transfer to a WIN network share
if you kill and restart nautilus, does it run normally? also, you might try turning off snort temporarily to help isolate the problem.
no, it goes to 40% then kicks to 100% after a few mins. the same with a reboot.
does turning off snort help?
on it, one sec
done, I stopped snort and then killed nautilus. seems like its fixed. the large file transfer must have been a coincidence then O.o
the file transfer windows were frozen, so I assumed wrong.
yeah, maybe. if you restart snort, does the behaviour resume?
I'm trying that right now, lets see
started, thus far seems to be all good. I'm lost as to what it could have been.
no telling with nautilus, i'm afraid :-) at least you have a solution of sorts, should the problem reappear.
thanks for the support, much apreciated. I'll keep an eye on it and try to check how the log sizes are doing.
